text: <@U0106M26108> It’s and experiment that the Japanese have made and NHK posted on news on the 31st of March that is looking at the standard amount of micro and macro droplets circulating in the air. The videos are accurate, but they don’t know what level of micro droplets could in effect be infectious, and if and how much of the virus is aereosolised therefore the reason they recommend 2 mr distance and to create currents of Air in closed spaces by opening windows. The science does not exactly know the amount of viral load and droplets needed that could lead to infection. Given that, 2 m is the safe distance for big droplets and airy places for micro.

attachments.service_name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
attachments.title: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
attachments.text: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a virus (more specifically, a coronavirus) identified as the cause of an outbreak of respiratory illness first detected in Wuhan, China.
